October Quarterly Metrics A Message to M&PM and E&T Leaders Regarding Intellectual Property Metrics
November 18, 2013
Dear Colleagues:
Honeywell is one of the Top 30 companies in patents granted in the United States each year with Aerospace contributing about 40% of those patents. The continued creativity and submittal of invention ideas is critical for the protection of our product revenue and competitive advantage. As a result, we encourage the prompt submittal of invention ideas that support our products through the Worldwide Invention Disclosure System <https://wids.honeywell.com/Index.aspx?err=logout> (WIDS), and are asking for your support in sharing this message across your organization.
For the M&PM and E&T leaders on this distribution, we will be providing quarterly metrics in the areas of relevance to your organization. The intent is to inform and solicit your support to drive actions as needed for your area of influence.
The appended metrics (1) Disclosure Submittals and (2) Disclosure Decisions (patent filings) have been prepared year-to-date through October. (October 2013 Quarterly Metrics <http://teamsites.honeywell.com/sites/IPTracking/Wiki/2013%20Actuals/2013%20New%20Quarterly%20Metrics/Quarterly%20Metrics_October%202013.pptx>)
(1) Disclosure Submittals (by IP Steering Committee YTD vs. Historical)
Purpose: Communicate quantity of disclosures received from Aerospace inventors versus historical averages Details: Purple line indicates historical year-to-date average. Percentages indicate disclosures received year-to-date as a % of the historical annual average.
Commentary:
- Disclosure submittals for Aerospace overall are up 8% over the historical average 2011 / 2012. - There is variation among the IP Steering Committees, as shown below, some far exceeding historical averages and some far below
Who has actions: >>> E&T T3 Leaders - Monitor deviations from historical averages. Is this in line with your expectations? Drive actions as needed within your organization.
(2) Disclosures Decisions (to File US patents by IP Steering Committee YTD)
Purpose: Communicate quantity of disclosures reviewed by each IPSC steering committee. Out of those, highlight the quantity and % of decisions to File patents in the US
Details: Total bar (green + blue) indicates the number of disclosures in which a decision was made (file or no file) in each IPSC year to date. Green bar indicates the quantity of those decisions that were “yes” to file
Commentary:
- Disclosure submittals for Aerospace overall are 29% of all decisions made. This is down from 32% in 2012, 35% in 2011. - There is variation among the IP Steering Committees some far exceeding the average and some far below.
Who has actions: >>> IPSC Leaders - Review the filing rate which is influenced by incoming disclosure quality and/or IPSC review standards. Is this filing rate in line with your expectations? Drive actions as needed.
Thank you for your continued work in driving our IP protection program. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.
Thank you, Dan Dan Gutfreund IP Process Leader Technology Strategy, Advanced Technology 21111 N 19th Ave (M/S 2J35A5) Phoenix, AZ 85027 Phone: +1 602 436-9030 Mobile: +1 480 258-8692 Dan.Gutfreund@Honeywell.com <mailto:Dan.Gutfreund@Honeywell.com> Privacy Statement <http://honeywell.com/Privacy> Terms & Conditions <http://honeywell.com/Pages/TermsConditions.aspx> © 2013 Honeywell International Inc. <http://www.honeywell.com>
